snippet: The announcement in the case against Khalid Shaikh Mohammed was the latest twist in a high-level debate that has divided national security officials in the Obama administration.
abstract: Pentagon says Bruce MacDonald, top official overseeing military commissions system, will not drop charge of conspiracy against Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and four other defendants in September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks, despite attempt by chief prosecutor to dismiss charge.
lead_paragraph: The announcement in the case against Khalid Shaikh Mohammed was the latest twist in a high-level debate that has divided national security officials in the Obama administration.

headline.seo: Pentagon Won’t Drop Conspiracy Charge Against Khalid Shaikh Mohammed
headline.main: Military Prosecutor Battles to Drop Conspiracy Charge in 9/11 Case
headline.print_headline: Military Prosecutor to Keep 9/11 Conspiracy Charge
